info.description:
Workflow Service handles workflow requirements for all applications built on OT2, with features such as :

* Integration with OT2 foundation services for authentication and authorization.
* Ability to define, deploy and query process models supporting BPMN 2.0.
* Ability to create, administer and monitor process instances. 
* Support for different type of workflow activities such as user tasks, http tasks, mail tasks, script tasks etc.
* Ability to manage user tasks for users and groups.
info.title: Workflow REST API

200.description: Indicates the requested privileges were returned.

get.description: List privileges in the current subscription context.

204.description: Indicates the group privilege has been deleted

400.description: Indicates that the request body is not valid.

delete.description: Delete a specific privilege for one or more groups in the current subscription context, using group ids or group names. The available privilege names can be retrieved using the list privileges API.
delete.summary: Delete a specific privilege for group(s)

200.description: Indicates the group privilege has been added

400.description: Indicates that the request body is not valid.

post.description: Add a specific privilege for one or more groups in the current subscription context, using group ids or group names. The available privilege names can be retrieved using the list privileges API.
post.summary: Add a specific privilege for group(s)

204.description: Indicates the role privilege has been deleted

400.description: Indicates that the request body is not valid.

delete.description: Delete a specific privilege for one or more roles in the current subscription context, using role ids or role names. The available privilege names can be retrieved using the list privileges API.
delete.summary: Delete a specific privilege for role(s)

200.description: Indicates the role privilege has been added

400.description: Indicates that the request body is not valid.

post.description: Add a specific privilege for one or more roles in the current subscription context, using role ids or role names. The available privilege names can be retrieved using the list privileges API.
post.summary: Add a specific privilege for role(s)

204.description: Indicates the user privilege has been deleted

400.description: Indicates that the request body is not valid.

delete.description: Delete a specific privilege for one or more users in the current subscription context, using user ids or user names. The available privilege names can be retrieved using the list privileges API.
delete.summary: Delete a specific privilege for user(s)

200.description: Indicates the user privilege has been added

400.description: Indicates that the request body is not valid.

post.description: Add a specific privilege for one or more users in the current subscription context, using user ids or user names. The available privilege names can be retrieved using the list privileges API.
post.summary: Add a specific privilege for user(s)

parameters.name: nameLike

parameters.name: key

parameters.name: filterByCurrentSubscription

parameters.description: Start position value in the list of items, used for pagination.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.name: sort

200.description: Indicates request was successful and the models are returned

400.description: Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format. The status-message contains additional information.

get.description: Get the non-executable process models.

200.description: successful operation

204.description: Indicates the non-executable process model was successfully deployed.

post.description:
Save the contents of BPMN based process model, which can be used for application development. No process instances can be triggered on the saved process models. The process model can be defined using the workflow modeler. The content of the process model (required for modelContent) can be exported and copied as a BPMN 2.0 encoded xml or BPMN 2.0 json directly from the workflow modeler. Sample request body :
{
"name": "SampleModel",
"key": "SampleKey",
"category": "SampleCategory",
"modelType": "xml/json",
"modelContent": "encoded BPMN xml content for xml type / plain BPMN json for json type"
}
post.summary: Create a non-executable process model

204.description: Indicates the model was found and has been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

404.description: Indicates the requested model was not found.

delete.description: Delete the current version of the non-executable process model.

200.description: Indicates the model was found and source is returned.

404.description: Indicates the requested model was not found.

get.description: Retrieve the BPMN 2.0 xml/json content of the non executable process model.

200.description: Indicates successful conversion of process model from json to xml or vice versa

400.description: Indicates process model cannot be converted

post.description:
Convert process model content from json to xml or vice versa. Sample request body :
{
"modelType": "xml/json",
"modelContent": "encoded BPMN xml content for xml type / plain BPMN json for json type"
}

requestBody.description: Convert process model content from json to xml or vice versa

post.summary: Convert process model content from json to xml or vice versa

200.description: Indicates the json/xml model is validated and has no errors

400.description: Indicates the json/xml model has validation errors

post.description:
Validate process model content. Sample request body :
{
"modelType": "xml/json",
"modelContent": "encoded BPMN xml content for xml type / plain BPMN json for json type"
}
post.summary: Validate process model content

get.description: List process instances.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the process instance was successfully created.

400.description: Indicates either the process-definition was not found (based on id or key), no process is started by sending the given message or an invalid variable has been passed. Status description contains additional information about the error.

post.description: Create a process instance using either processDefinitionKey, processDefinitionId or message name.processDefinitionKey, processDefinitionId are same as the key, id retrieved in the create a new executable process model response respectively.message is same as the message name configured in the process model.

204.description: Indicates the execution was found and the action is performed.

404.description: Indicates the execution was not found.

400.description: Signal not processed. The signal name is missing or variables are used together with async, which is not allowed. Response body contains additional information about the error.

post.description: Broadcast signal to trigger process models with a configured start signal event and create process instances.
post.summary: Broadcast signal to create process instances

200.description: successful operation

400.description: Indicates the request body is incomplete or contains illegal values. The status description contains additional information about the error.

404.description: Indicates the requested process instance was not found.

409.description: Indicates the process instance was found but already contains a variable with the given name (only thrown when POST method is used). Use the update-method instead.

post.description:
Create one or more variables on a process instance. Sample request body :
[
{
"name": "SampleVariable",
"type": "string",
"value": "SampleValue",
"scope": "local"
}
]

aclId.description: Permission object id which is already created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service)

fileId.description: File id which is already created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service)

fileName.description: Name of the file to be created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service)

parentFolderId.description: Parent folder id which is already created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service)

requestBody.description: Create one of more variables on a process instance

post.summary: Create variables on a process instance

parameters.description: For file input variable, use cascade = true to delete the file along with the variable.
parameters.name: cascade

parameters.description: For file input variable, use cascadeContent = true to delete the file content along with the variable.
parameters.name: cascadeContent

Update a single variable on a process instance. Sample request body :

}

get.description: Get the executable process models across all deployed versions.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the executable process model was successfully deployed.

400.description: Indicates that the model has errors.

post.description:
Deploy the contents of BPMN based process model. Process instances can be triggered for these deployed process models. Use the "key" returned in the API response to create process instances for the deployed model.
If the same process model is updated and deployed again, a higher version of the process model is deployed. New process instances are always created on the latest versions of the process models, and the previously triggered process instances continue to run on the corresponding older versions.The process model can be defined using the workflow modeler. The content of the process model (required for modelContent) can be exported and copied as a BPMN 2.0 encoded xml or BPMN 2.0 json directly from the workflow modeler. Sample request body :
{
"modelId" : "SampleModelId",
"modelType": "xml/json",
"modelContent": "encoded BPMN xml content for xml type / plain BPMN json for json type"
}

requestBody.description: Create a new executable process model

post.summary: Create a new executable process model

200.description: Indicates that deployment is found and the deployment data has been returned.

400.description: Indicates that model type in the request is not supported.

404.description: Indicates the requested deployment was not found or there is no resource with the given id present in the deployment.

get.description: Retrieve executable process model content based on the given model id.

204.description: Indicates the deployment was found and has been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

404.description: Indicates the requested deployment was not found.

delete.description: Delete a specific version of the executable process model and its corresponding process instances.

parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given name.
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Only return tasks with a name like the given name.
parameters.name: nameLike

parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given description.
parameters.name: description

parameters.description: Only return tasks with the given priority.
parameters.name: priority

parameters.description: Only return tasks with a priority greater than the given value.
parameters.name: minimumPriority

parameters.description: Only return tasks with a priority lower than the given value.
parameters.name: maximumPriority

parameters.description: Only return tasks assigned to the given user. The assignee should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context, user email id should be provided.
parameters.name: assignee

parameters.description: Only return tasks assigned with an assignee like the given value. The assignee should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context, and user email id should be provided. This parameter works only with user emails.
parameters.name: assigneeLike

parameters.description: Only return tasks owned by the given user. The owner should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context, and user email id should be provided.
parameters.name: owner

parameters.description: Only return tasks assigned with an owner like the given value. The owner should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context, and user email id should be provided. This parameter works only with user emails.
parameters.name: ownerLike

parameters.description: Only return tasks that are not assigned to anyone. If false is passed, the value is ignored.
parameters.name: unassigned

parameters.description: Only return tasks that have the given delegation state. Possible values are pending and resolved.
parameters.name: delegationState

parameters.description: Only return tasks that can be claimed by the given user. This includes both tasks where the user is an explicit candidate for and task that are claimable by a group that the user is a member of. The candidateUser should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context, and user email id should be provided.
parameters.name: candidateUser

parameters.description: Only return tasks that can be claimed by a user in the given group. The group should be a valid application role or a group with associated user mappings in the provided tenant and subscription context, and application role name or group name should be provided.
parameters.name: candidateGroup

parameters.description: Only return tasks that can be claimed by a user in the given groups. Values split by comma. The group should be a valid application role or a group with associated user mappings in the provided tenant and subscription context, and application role name or group name should be provided.
parameters.name: candidateGroups

parameters.description: Only return tasks in which the given user is involved. The involvedUser should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context.
parameters.name: involvedUser

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the process instance with the given id.
parameters.name: processInstanceId

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the process instance and its children with the given id.
parameters.name: processInstanceIdWithChildren

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are part of the process instance with the given business key.
parameters.name: processInstanceBusinessKey

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are created on the given date.

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are created before the given date.
parameters.name: createdBefore

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are created after the given date.
parameters.name: createdAfter

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are due on the given date.

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are due before the given date.
parameters.name: dueBefore

parameters.description: Only return tasks which are due after the given date.

parameters.description: Only return tasks which do not have a due date. The property is ignored if the value is false.
parameters.name: withoutDueDate

parameters.description: Only return tasks that are not a subtask of another task.
parameters.name: excludeSubTasks

parameters.description: If true, only return tasks that are not suspended (either part of a process that is not suspended or not part of a process at all). If false, only tasks that are part of suspended process instances are returned.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description: Indication to include task local variables in the result.

parameters.name: includeProcessVariables

parameters.description: Indication to include task comments in the result.
parameters.name: includeTaskComments

parameters.description: Indication to include task assignments in the result.
parameters.name: includeTaskAssignments

parameters.description: Select tasks that has been claimed or assigned to user or waiting to claim by user (candidate user or groups).The candidateUser should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context. The group should be a valid application role or a group with associated user mappings in the provided tenant and subscription context.
parameters.name: candidateOrAssigned

parameters.description: Select tasks with the given category. Note that this is the task category, not the category of the process definition (namespace within the BPMN Xml).
parameters.name: category

parameters.description: Only return the process tasks in the current subscription
parameters.name: filterByCurrentSubscription

parameters.description: Start position value in the list of items, used for pagination.
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Number of items to be limited in the response, used for pagination. By default the count value is set to 10.
parameters.name: count

parameters.description:
Property to sort on, to be used together with the order.
To sort on process or task variables, make sure the variables are available in the response and provide the input to sort on variable:<variableName>
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: Order to be used together with the sort.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: Indication to include OTDS Id instead of email for users in the response.
parameters.name: includeUserIds

parameters.description: Indication to include id instead of name for groups and roles in response.
parameters.name: includeGroupIds

parameters.description: If true, empty values are ordered at top of list. If false, empty values are ordered at bottom of list
parameters.name: sortEmptyValuesOnTop

404.description: Indicates a parameter was passed in the wrong format or that delegationState has an invalid value (other than pending and resolved). The status-message contains additional information.

200.description: Indicates the task was found and returned.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have permissions on the requested task.

get.description: Retrieve a task based on given task id.

400.description: When the body contains an invalid value or when the assignee is missing when the action requires it.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have permissions on the requested task or the action violates the task delivery type.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

409.description: Indicates the action cannot be performed due to a conflict. Either the task was updates simultaneously or the task was claimed by another user, in case of the claim action.

post.description: Act on a task. Possible actions are complete, claim, delegate, resolve, unclaim.
post.summary: Act on a task

200.description: Indicates the task was updated.

403.description: Indicates the user does not have permissions on the requested task or the action violates the task delivery type.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

409.description: Indicates the requested task was updated simultaneously.

put.description:
Update the task data based on a given task id.
For task assignment updates :
Task assignments are supported for user or group targets, which are managed using Admin center.
For task assignment to a user, the user should be a valid user in the provided tenant and subscription context, and user email id should be provided.
For task assignment to a group, the group should be a valid application role or a group with associated user mappings in the provided tenant and subscription context, and application role name or group name should be provided.

204.description: Indicates the task and identity link were found and the link has been deleted. Response-body is intentionally empty.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the task does not have the requested identityLink. The status contains additional information about this error.

get.description: List attachments on a task.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the attachment was created and the result is returned.

400.description: Indicates the attachment name is missing from the request.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

post.description:
Create a new attachment on a task, either by linking to an external resource url or by providing a file input.
An external resource url can be linked as a task attachment by providing the required details in the json request body as below.

Sample request body :
{
"name" : "SampleAttachment"
"description" : "SampleDescription "
"type" : "SampleType "
"externalUrl" : "https://.."
"includeUserIds" : false
}

A file can also be directly uploaded as a task attachment by providing the reference file as a "multipart/form-data" Content-Type input. By default the file is uploaded and linked to OT2 content store (Content metadata service & Content storage service).

aclId.description: Permission object id which is already created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service), optional when attachment is created be file input.

description.description: Description of the attachment, optional when attachment is created be file input.

fileId.description: File id which is already created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service), optional when attachment is created be file input.

fileName.description: Name of the file to be created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service)

name.description: Name of the attachment, required when attachment is created by file input.

parentFolderId.description: Parent folder id which is already created in the OT2 contest store(Content metadata service & Content storage service), optional when attachment is created be file input.

type.description: Type of attachment, optionalwhen attachment is created be file input. Supports any arbitrary string or a valid HTTP content-type.

requestBody.description: create an attachment containing a link to an external resource

post.summary: Create a new attachment on a task.

parameters.description: For file input attachment, use cascade = true to delete the file along with the attachment.
parameters.name: cascade

parameters.description: For file input attachment, use cascadeContent = true to delete the file content along with the attachment.
parameters.name: cascadeContent

204.description: Indicates the task and attachment were found and the attachment is deleted. Response body is left empty intentionally.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found or the tasks does not have a attachment with the given ID.

delete.description:
Delete an attachment on a task.
If cascade parameter is set to true, the corresponding file in the OT2 content store(Content metadata service & Content storage service) will also be deleted along with the task attachment.
delete.summary: Delete an attachment on a task

get.description: List variables for a task.

200.description: successful operation

201.description: Indicates the task was found and variable is created.

400.description: Indicates the request body is incomplete or contains illegal values. The status description contains additional information about the error.

404.description: Indicates the requested task was not found.

409.description: Indicates the task was found but already contains a variable with the given name (only thrown when POST method is used). Use the update-method instead.

post.description:
Create one or more variables on a task. Sample request body :
[
{
"name": "SampleVariable",
"type": "string",
"value": "SampleValue",
"scope": "local"
}
]

requestBody.description: Create variables on a process instance

WorkflowProcessInstanceCreateRequest.description: Only one of processDefinitionId, processDefinitionKey or message can be used in the request body

async.description:
If true, handling of the signal will happen asynchronously. Return code will be 202 - Accepted to indicate the request is accepted but not yet executed. If false,
                    handling the signal will be done immediately and result (200 - OK) will only return after this completed successfully. Defaults to false if omitted.

variables.description: Array of variables (in the general variables format) to use as payload to pass along with the signal. Cannot be used in case async is set to true, this will result in an error.

assignee.description: If action is claim or delegate, you can use this parameter to set the assignee associated

formDefinitionId.description: Required when completing a task with a form

outcome.description: Optional outcome value when completing a task with a form

transientVariables.description: If action is complete, you can use this parameter to set transient variables

variables.description: If action is complete, you can use this parameter to set variables

delegationState.description: Delegation-state of the task, can be null, "pending" or "resolved".
